meanings.definition: Something that is carried or borne.
meanings.sent1: The backpack was a burden during the long hike.
meanings.sent2: She carried the burden of her mistakes with grace.
meanings.sent3: The burden of her secrets was almost too much to bear.
meanings.sent4: The burden of history is evident in the old artifacts.
meanings.sent5: The burden of tradition weighed heavily on their family.

meanings.definition: A source of worry or stress.
meanings.sent1: The burden of upcoming exams kept her up at night.
meanings.sent2: Financial troubles can be a heavy burden to bear.
meanings.sent3: The burden of planning the party was unexpectedly fun.
meanings.sent4: The burden of uncertainty loomed over their decision.
meanings.sent5: The burden of expectation can be overwhelming at times.
